result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian J. Beard

records.addlTxt: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Impaired Driving

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the Defendant. The defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

ADDRESS INFO for Christian J. Beard
Current: 448 15th Ave, East Moline, IL 61244 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2022)
Prior: 1169 23RD STREET, MOLINE, IL 61265

1:30 PM Cases 22CM28, 22TR 430, 431 432 & 433 called together- appearances stated. 
Defendant Christian J. Beard in court.  Attorney Dominic J. Anderson appeared by phone for Christian J. Beard.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court questions Def - Def. states he did receive a copy of complaint and has discussed it with his attorney.

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  

Atty. Anderson states def. wishes to enter plea of Not Guilty as to each count in complaint
Court directs clerk to enter NOT GUILTY pleas to all counts in the criminal complaint and each of the TR case

Atty. Steiner is heard on issue of bond - requests signature bond with condition Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court sets $500 Signature bond with conditions: Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant.Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Judge Rider's response to counsel's letter regarding the 6/20/22 at 1:30 PM Initial Appearance - the defendant must appear in person so the court will reschedule the Initial Appearance to July 18th.  Atty Anderson may appear by zoom if he wishes.  JA will work with counsel on a time. hb
Letter to Court - Request to Appear via Zoom & Request for Reschedule
Defendant's Authorization for Attorney to Appear and Act
Initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
